Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of protection that the gun industry has from liability, stating that they are "wholly protected from any kind of liability" when in fact there are some situations in which they can be held liable.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the gun industry is the only business in America with such protection from liability.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the gun industry is the only business with this level of protection without considering other industries or federal laws that restrict liability for various types of businesses.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations or exceptions to the protection from liability, such as situations where gun dealers knowingly transfer firearms for criminal purposes or when the gun itself is defective and causes injury.
